name: phlox maculata
description: Wild Sweet William is also often called Meadow Phlox, or Speckled and Spotted Phlox for the spots or streaks on the main stem.  It can be distinguised from other Phlox mainly because of this characteristic.  The leaves are dark green and shiny.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
